Title: Wisconsin Council of Churches Coronavirus Information
Description: Provide assistance during Covid following bibical doctrine. Combating fear with knowledge in order to encourage preparedness and decrease stigmamaintaining operational continuity and continuing expressions of Christian life in the case of quarantine and disruptionshowing Godâ€™s compassion and care to those in our communities who are affected

Title: Vaccines.Gov
Description: Provide a map to particpating individuals to receive their COVID vaccine. The map provides areas that distribute the following vaccines: Moderna, Pfizer-BioNTech, Johnson & Johnson.

Title: Dear Pandemic
Description: An interdisciplinary all-woman team of researchers and clinicians with expertise including nursing, mental health, demography, health policy/economics, and epidemiology. Their mission to educate individuals to navigate the COVID-19 information overwhelm. They provide credible, curated, and timely information about the pandemic catered to the public.

Title: Southwestern Wisconsin Community Action Program
Description: A rural, nonprofit, anti-poverty, agency, that serves the Wisconsin counties of Grant, Green, Iowa, Lafayette, and Richland. They host diverse programs and services to help individuals and families who are low-income. With the added stressors of the pandemic, they are helping those who are stuggling to meet basic needs due to COVID such as rent assistance, food pantries, utilities, etc.

Title: Wisconsin Immunization Program
Description: The Wisconsin Immunizaiton Program is a partnership and collaboration with local partners, striving to eliminate the transmission of vaccine preventable disease through effective immunization programs and outbreak control measures. Information pertaining to different kinds of vaccinations is offered on their website.

Title: Grant Regional Health Center
Description: Together we are dedicated to improve the health and wellness of all generations through high quality, compassionate, patient-centered care. Grant Regional Health Center helps their community navigating the COVID pandemic through presenting updates, vaccinations, testing, and tips for staying healthy during the pandemic.

Title: Grant County Board of Health
Description: This service promotes prevention or early detection of disease for individuals, their families, and the community. There is no charge for many public health services. Included are immunizations; follow-up of communicable diseases; health counseling; screening and safety programs; school and jail health; and environmental health services.

Title: UW Extension Health Communications
Description: The role of UW Health Marketing and Communications is to communicate with patient and consumer audiences about UW Health's programs and services. Detailed site showcasing many resources about the COVID-19 pandemic. Provides sites for vaccination, testing, frequently asked questions, and other disciplines in the surronding health community.

Title: Institute for Health and Well-Being
Description: The Extension Institute of Health & Well-Being works to craft positive change in Wisconsin families through evidence-based programs focused on nutrition, food security and safety, chronic disease prevention, mental health promotion, and prevention of substance abuse. Rooted in both urban and rural communities, to improve the health and well-being of Wisconsin residents.

Title: Wisconsin Institute for Healthy Aging
Description: WIHA supports public policy initiatives and systems change that positively impacts the health and wellness of people in Wisconsin as they grow older. The organization offers a multitude of resources catered to aging populations focusing on maintainig a healthy lifestyle through community.

Title: UW Extension
Description: Extension's mission is to connect people with the University of Wisconsin. They are working to bring communites across Wisconsin closer together.

Title: UW Platteville
Description: Since 1866, the University of Wisconsin-Platteville has been a regional leader with challenging academics; renowned faculty; and notable alumni. And, during these unprecedented times of COVID-19, our faculty, staff, and students are applying their research and skills to impact our communities in a positive way. UW-Platteville provides students, staff, and community more in depth information following the pandemic and vaccination availability.

Title: Southwest Health
Description: Southwest Health is a health center following the COVID-19 pandemic sharing statistics, mental health services, and CDC faq sheets for patients.

Title: Gunderson Health
Description: At Gundersen Health System is sharing the latest news on the COVID-19 pandemic. They offer the following services for individuals: screening and tesing, vaccinations, tips for wellness with COVID virus.

Title: UW-Madison Dept of Madison
Description: The Wisconsin Partnership Program is a program catered to help those across campus and Wisconsin communites through the COVID pandemic. They are responding to the current crisis in several ways: by supporting current grantees, developing COVID-19 Response grant programs and supporting strategic partnerships across campus.

Title: UW-Madison Prevention Research Center
Description: "The UWPRC is the center that the C3 project is funded out of. The overarching goal of the UWPRC is to improve the health of low-income women
Resource Type: and families by conducting health promotion and disease prevention research focused on maternal
